00022 #ifndef CUBECOMMUNICATION_H
00023 #define CUBECOMMUNICATION_H
00024 
00025 #include <QObject>
00026 #include <QString>
00027 #include <QBitArray>
00028 #include <QByteArray>
00029 #include <QComboBox>
00030 #include <QDebug>
00031 #include <QPushButton>
00032 
00033 class QextSerialPort;
00034 
00036 /*
00037   It Uses the extern class QExtSerialPort for the platform-independent handling of a Serial Connection (http://qextserialport.sourceforge.net/)
00038   For Programming, a SerialThread is being launched.
00039 */
00040 
00041 class CubeCommunication : public QObject
00042 {
00043     Q_OBJECT
00044 public:
00045     CubeCommunication(QObject * parent = 0, QComboBox * ComPortComboBox = 0);
00046     bool isConnected();
00047     bool isLiveMode();
00048 
00049 
00050 public slots:
00051     void ConnectionToggle(bool state);
00052     void LiveModeToggle(bool state);
00053     void startProgramming(QByteArray data, int countRows);
00054     void updateLiveModeStates(QBitArray *states);
00055 
00056 private:
00057     QextSerialPort *serial;
00058     QComboBox* ComPortCombo; 
00059     int ConnectionOpen();
00060     int ConnectionClose();
00061     int ConnectionTest();
00062     int LiveModeEnter();
00063     int LiveModeLeave();
00064     QString currentPort;    
00065     bool connected;
00066     bool liveModeActive;
00067 
00068 signals:
00069     void programmingPercentage(int percentage); 
00070     void programmingSuccessful();   
00071     void programmingFailed();       
00072     void openingCOMPortSuccessful(QString COMPortName); 
00073     void openingCOMPortFailed(QString COMPortName); 
00074     void findingCubeFailed(QString COMPortName); 
00075 
00076 
00077 };
00078 
00079 #endif // CUBECOMMUNICATION_H
